That's fantastic! Composting is a great way to turn kitchen waste into a valuable resource for your garden. By composting, you're not only reducing waste, but you're also creating a natural fertilizer that's rich in nutrients and beneficial microorganisms. Your plants will love it!

It's great that you attended a gardening workshop at the community center. Those types of events are always a great way to learn new techniques, get tips from experienced gardeners, and connect with like-minded people. Composting and mulching are both excellent skills to have in your gardening toolkit, and I'm sure you'll see the benefits in your garden soon.

Using neem cake is also a great move. Neem cake is a natural pest repellent that can help control a wide range of pests, from insects to nematodes. By adding it to your soil, you're creating a pest-repellent environment that will help protect your plants from harm. It's a great way to maintain a balanced ecosystem in your garden.

Remember to keep your compost pile balanced by adding a mix of "green" materials (like kitchen scraps, grass clippings, and fresh leaves) and "brown" materials (like dried leaves, twigs, and shredded newspaper). This will help speed up the decomposition process and create a rich, nutrient-dense compost.

When you're ready to use your compost, make sure to mix it well into the soil around your plants. You can also use it as a mulch or side dressing to give your plants an extra boost of nutrients.

What's your favorite part about composting? Is it the idea of reducing waste, creating a natural fertilizer, or seeing the benefits in your garden?
